intro: Dryopsis dulongensis, commonly known as the Dulong's dryops, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of white or pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
